alert.note: Alert for Cimarron (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 4:55PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Cimarron County through 545 PM CDT... At 454 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Felt, or 12 miles southwest of Boise City, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Boise City, Keyes, Kenton, Wheeless, Black Mesa Park, and Felt. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for the Panhandle of Oklahoma...and the Panhandle of Texas.
